396  template <size_t SIZE>
397  MDBX_CXX14_CONSTEXPR slice(const char (&text)[SIZE]) noexcept
398  : slice(text, SIZE - 1) {
399  static_assert(SIZE > 0 && text[SIZE - 1] == '\0',
400  "Must be a null-terminated C-string");
401  }
403  explicit MDBX_CXX17_CONSTEXPR slice(const char *c_str);
404 
406  /* 'explicit' to avoid reference to the temporary std::string instance */
407  template <class C, class T, class A>
408  explicit MDBX_CXX20_CONSTEXPR slice(const ::std::basic_string<C, T, A> &str)
409  : slice(str.data(), str.length() * sizeof(C)) {}
410

412  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR slice(const slice &) noexcept = default;
413 #if defined(DOXYGEN) || \

417  explicit MDBX_CXX14_CONSTEXPR slice(const ::std::basic_string_view<C, T> &sv)
418  : slice(sv.data(), sv.data() + sv.length()) {}
419 #endif /* __cpp_lib_string_view >= 201606L */
420 
421  inline slice(MDBX_val &&src);
422  inline slice(slice &&src) noexcept;

433  return slice(text);
434  }

436  template <typename POD>
437  MDBX_CXX14_CONSTEXPR static slice wrap(const POD &pod) {
438  static_assert(::std::is_standard_layout<POD>::value &&
439  !std::is_pointer<POD>::value,
440  "Must be a standard layout type!");
441  return slice(&pod, sizeof(pod));

504  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR size_t
505  to_hex_bytes(unsigned wrap_width = 0) const noexcept {
506  const size_t bytes = length() << 1;
507  return wrap_width ? bytes + bytes / wrap_width : bytes;
508  }

519  return length() >> 1;
520  }

525  char *to_base58(char *dest, size_t dest_size, unsigned wrap_width = 0) const;
526 
529  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR size_t
530  to_base58_bytes(unsigned wrap_width = 0) const noexcept {
531  const size_t bytes = length() / 8 * 11 + (length() % 8 * 43 + 31) / 32;
532  return wrap_width ? bytes + bytes / wrap_width : bytes;
533  }
534 
538  byte *from_base58(byte *dest, size_t dest_size,
539  bool ignore_spaces = false) const;
540 
543  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR size_t from_base58_bytes() const noexcept {
544  return length() / 11 * 8 + length() % 11 * 32 / 43;
545  }
546 
550  char *to_base64(char *dest, size_t dest_size, unsigned wrap_width = 0) const;
551 
554  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR size_t
555  to_base64_bytes(unsigned wrap_width = 0) const noexcept {
556  const size_t bytes = (length() + 2) / 3 * 4;
557  return wrap_width ? bytes + bytes / wrap_width : bytes;
558  }
559 
563  byte *from_base64(byte *dest, size_t dest_size,
564  bool ignore_spaces = false) const;
565 
568  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR size_t from_base64_bytes() const noexcept {
569  return (length() + 3) / 4 * 3;
570  }

658  inline void swap(slice &other) noexcept;
659 #if defined(DOXYGEN) || \
660  (defined(__cpp_lib_string_view) && __cpp_lib_string_view >= 201606L)
661  template <class C, class T>

722  ends_with(const slice &suffix) const noexcept;

761  hash_value() const noexcept;
762 
770  MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION static inline intptr_t
771  compare_fast(const slice &a, const slice &b) noexcept;
772 
778  MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION static inline intptr_t
779  compare_lexicographically(const slice &a, const slice &b) noexcept;
780  friend inline bool operator==(const slice &a, const slice &b) noexcept;
781  friend inline bool operator<(const slice &a, const slice &b) noexcept;
782  friend inline bool operator>(const slice &a, const slice &b) noexcept;
783  friend inline bool operator<=(const slice &a, const slice &b) noexcept;
784  friend inline bool operator>=(const slice &a, const slice &b) noexcept;
785  friend inline bool operator!=(const slice &a, const slice &b) noexcept;
786 
788  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR bool is_valid() const noexcept {
789  return !(iov_base == nullptr && iov_len != 0);
790  }
791 
794  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR static slice invalid() noexcept {
795  return slice(size_t(-1));
796  }
797 
798 protected:
799  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR slice(size_t invalid_length) noexcept
800  : ::MDBX_val({nullptr, invalid_length}) {}
801 };
802 
803 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
804 
806 template <class ALLOCATOR = legacy_allocator> class buffer {
807  friend class txn;
808  using silo = ::mdbx::string<ALLOCATOR>;
809  silo silo_;
810  ::mdbx::slice slice_;
811 
812  void insulate() {
813  assert(is_reference());
814  silo_.assign(slice_.char_ptr(), slice_.length());
815  slice_.iov_base = const_cast<char *>(silo_.data());
816  }
817 
818  MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION MDBX_CXX20_CONSTEXPR const byte *
819  silo_begin() const noexcept {
820  return static_cast<const byte *>(static_cast<const void *>(silo_.data()));
821  }
822 
823  MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION MDBX_CXX20_CONSTEXPR const byte *
824  silo_end() const noexcept {
825  return silo_begin() + silo_.capacity();
826  }
827 
828  struct data_preserver : public exception_thunk {
829  buffer data;
830  data_preserver(ALLOCATOR &allocator) : data(allocator) {}
831  static int callback(void *context, MDBX_val *target, const void *src,
832  size_t bytes) noexcept;
833  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR operator MDBX_preserve_func() const noexcept {
834  return callback;
835  }
836  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR operator const buffer &() const noexcept {
837  return data;
838  }
839  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR operator buffer &() noexcept { return data; }
840  };
841 
842 public:
846 
847  using allocator_type = ALLOCATOR;
848  enum : size_t {
849  max_length = MDBX_MAXDATASIZE,
850  default_shrink_threshold = 1024
851  };
852 
854  MDBX_CXX20_CONSTEXPR allocator_type get_allocator() const {
855  return silo_.get_allocator();
856  }
857 
860  MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION MDBX_CXX20_CONSTEXPR bool
861  is_freestanding() const noexcept {
862  return size_t(byte_ptr() - silo_begin()) < silo_.capacity();
863  }
864 
867  MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION MDBX_CXX20_CONSTEXPR bool
868  is_reference() const noexcept {
869  return !is_freestanding();
870  }
871 
874  MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION MDBX_CXX20_CONSTEXPR size_t
875  capacity() const noexcept {
876  return is_freestanding() ? silo_.capacity() : 0;
877  }
878 
881  MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION MDBX_CXX20_CONSTEXPR size_t
882  headroom() const noexcept {
883  return is_freestanding() ? slice_.byte_ptr() - silo_begin() : 0;
884  }
885 
888  MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION MDBX_CXX20_CONSTEXPR size_t
889  tailroom() const noexcept {
890  return is_freestanding() ? capacity() - headroom() - slice_.length() : 0;
891  }
892 
894  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR const byte *byte_ptr() const noexcept {
895  return slice_.byte_ptr();
896  }
897 
901  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR byte *byte_ptr() noexcept {
902  assert(is_freestanding());
903  return const_cast<byte *>(slice_.byte_ptr());
904  }
905 
907  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR const char *char_ptr() const noexcept {
908  return slice_.char_ptr();
909  }
910 
914  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR char *char_ptr() noexcept {
915  assert(is_freestanding());
916  return const_cast<char *>(slice_.char_ptr());
917  }
918 
920  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR const void *data() const noexcept {
921  return slice_.data();
922  }
923 
927  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR void *data() noexcept {
928  assert(is_freestanding());
929  return const_cast<void *>(slice_.data());
930  }
931 
933  MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION MDBX_CXX20_CONSTEXPR size_t
934  length() const noexcept {
935  return MDBX_CONSTEXPR_ASSERT(is_reference() ||
936  slice_.length() + headroom() ==
937  silo_.length()),
938  slice_.length();
939  }
940 
941  void make_freestanding() {
942  if (is_reference())
943  insulate();
944  }
945 
946  buffer(const ::mdbx::slice &src, bool make_reference,
947  const allocator_type &allocator = allocator_type())
948  : silo_(allocator), slice_(src) {
949  if (!make_reference)
950  insulate();
951  }

954  const allocator_type &allocator = allocator_type())
955  : buffer(src.slice_, make_reference, allocator) {}

958  const allocator_type &allocator = allocator_type())
959  : buffer(::mdbx::slice(ptr, bytes), make_reference, allocator) {}

1490 struct value_result {
1491  slice value;
1492  bool done;
1493  value_result(const slice &value, bool done) noexcept
1494  : value(value), done(done) {}
1495  value_result(const value_result &) noexcept = default;
1496  value_result &operator=(const value_result &) noexcept = default;
1497  MDBX_CXX14_CONSTEXPR operator bool() const noexcept {
1498  assert(!done || bool(value));
1499  return done;
1500  }
1501 };

1505 struct pair {
1506  slice key, value;
1507  pair(const slice &key, const slice &value) noexcept
1508  : key(key), value(value) {}
1509  pair(const pair &) noexcept = default;
1510  pair &operator=(const pair &) noexcept = default;
1511  MDBX_CXX14_CONSTEXPR operator bool() const noexcept {
1512  assert(bool(key) == bool(value));
1513  return key;
1514  }
1515 };
1516 
1519 struct pair_result : public pair {
1520  bool done;
1521  pair_result(const slice &key, const slice &value, bool done) noexcept
1522  : pair(key, value), done(done) {}
1523  pair_result(const pair_result &) noexcept = default;
1524  pair_result &operator=(const pair_result &) noexcept = default;
1525  MDBX_CXX14_CONSTEXPR operator bool() const noexcept {
1526  assert(!done || (bool(key) && bool(value)));
1527  return done;
1528  }
1529 };

2664  const buffer<ALLOCATOR> &it) {
2665  return (it.is_freestanding()
2666  ? out << "buf-" << it.headroom() << "." << it.tailroom()
2667  : out << "ref-")
2668  << it.slice();
2669 }

2707 static MDBX_CXX17_CONSTEXPR size_t strlen(const char *c_str) noexcept {
2708 #if defined(__cpp_lib_is_constant_evaluated) && \
2709  __cpp_lib_is_constant_evaluated >= 201811L
2710  if (::std::is_constant_evaluated()) {
2711  for (size_t i = 0; c_str; ++i)
2712  if (!c_str[i])
2713  return i;
2714  return 0;
2715  }
2716 #endif /* __cpp_lib_is_constant_evaluated >= 201811 */
2717 #if defined(__cpp_lib_string_view) && __cpp_lib_string_view >= 201606L
2718  return c_str ? ::std::string_view(c_str).length() : 0;
2719 #else
2720  return c_str ? ::std::strlen(c_str) : 0;
2721 #endif
2722 }
2723 
2724 MDBX_CXX14_CONSTEXPR size_t check_length(size_t bytes) {
2725  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(bytes > size_t(MDBX_MAXDATASIZE)))
2726  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY throw_max_length_exceeded();
2727  return bytes;
2728 }

2730 inline bool exception_thunk::is_clean() const noexcept { return !captured_; }
2731 
2732 inline void exception_thunk::capture() noexcept {
2733  assert(is_clean());
2734  captured_ = ::std::current_exception();
2735 }
2736 
2737 inline void exception_thunk::rethrow_captured() const {
2738  if (captured_)
2739  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY ::std::rethrow_exception(captured_);
2740 }

2765  return code_ == MDBX_RESULT_FALSE;
2766 }

2769  return code_ == MDBX_RESULT_TRUE;
2770 }

2773  return code_ != MDBX_SUCCESS && code_ != MDBX_RESULT_TRUE;
2774 }

2776 MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR MDBX_error_t error::code() const noexcept { return code_; }

2778 MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR bool error::is_mdbx_error() const noexcept {
2779  return (code() >= MDBX_FIRST_LMDB_ERRCODE &&
2780  code() <= MDBX_LAST_LMDB_ERRCODE) ||
2781  (code() >= MDBX_FIRST_ADDED_ERRCODE &&
2782  code() <= MDBX_LAST_ADDED_ERRCODE);
2783 }

2787  trouble.throw_exception();
2788 }

2790 inline void error::throw_on_failure() const {

2792  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY throw_exception();
2793 }

2795 inline void error::success_or_throw() const {
2796  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(!is_success()))
2797  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY throw_exception();
2798 }
2799 
2800 inline void error::success_or_throw(const exception_thunk &thunk) const {
2801  assert(thunk.is_clean() || code() != MDBX_SUCCESS);
2802  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(!is_success())) {
2803  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY if (!thunk.is_clean()) thunk.rethrow_captured();
2804  else throw_exception();
2805  }
2806 }
2807 
2808 inline void error::panic_on_failure(const char *context_where,
2809  const char *func_who) const noexcept {
2810  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(is_failure()))
2811  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY panic(context_where, func_who);
2812 }
2813

2815  const char *func_who) const noexcept {
2816  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(!is_success()))
2817  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY panic(context_where, func_who);
2818 }

2822  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY error(error_code).throw_exception();
2823 }

2835 inline bool error::boolean_or_throw(int error_code) {
2836  switch (error_code) {
2837  case MDBX_RESULT_FALSE:
2838  return false;
2839  case MDBX_RESULT_TRUE:
2840  return true;
2841  default:
2842  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY throw_exception(error_code);
2843  }
2844 }

3005 MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION MDBX_CXX14_CONSTEXPR size_t
3006 slice::hash_value() const noexcept {
3007  size_t h = length() * 3977471;
3008  for (size_t i = 0; i < length(); ++i)
3009  h = (h ^ static_cast<const uint8_t *>(data())[i]) * 1664525 + 1013904223;
3010  return h ^ 3863194411 * (h >> 11);
3011 }

3059 inline intptr_t slice::compare_fast(const slice &a, const slice &b) noexcept {
3060  const intptr_t diff = a.length() - b.length();
3061  return diff ? diff
3062  : (a.data() == b.data())
3063  ? 0
3064  : ::std::memcmp(a.data(), b.data(), a.length());
3065 }

3067 inline intptr_t slice::compare_lexicographically(const slice &a,
3068  const slice &b) noexcept {
3069  const intptr_t diff =
3070  ::std::memcmp(a.data(), b.data(), ::std::min(a.length(), b.length()));
3071  return diff ? diff : intptr_t(a.length() - b.length());
3072 }

3453 inline bool env::sync_to_disk(bool force, bool nonblock) {
3454  const int err = ::mdbx_env_sync_ex(handle_, force, nonblock);
3455  switch (err) {
3456  case MDBX_SUCCESS /* flush done */:
3457  case MDBX_RESULT_TRUE /* no data pending for flush to disk */:
3458  return true;
3459  case MDBX_BUSY /* the environment is used by other thread */:
3460  return false;
3461  default:
3462  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY error::throw_exception(err);
3463  }
3464 }

3471 env::reader_info::reader_info(int slot, mdbx_pid_t pid, mdbx_tid_t thread,

3477 template <typename VISITOR>
3478 inline int env::enumerate_readers(VISITOR &visitor) {
3479  struct reader_visitor_thunk : public exception_thunk {
3480  VISITOR &visitor_;
3481  static int cb(void *ctx, int number, int slot, mdbx_pid_t pid,
3482  mdbx_tid_t thread, uint64_t txnid, uint64_t lag, size_t used,
3483  size_t retained) noexcept {
3484  reader_visitor_thunk *thunk = static_cast<reader_visitor_thunk *>(ctx);
3485  assert(thunk->is_clean());
3486  try {
3487  const reader_info info(slot, pid, thread, txnid, lag, used, retained);
3488  return loop_control(thunk->visitor_(info, number));
3489  } catch (... /* capture any exception to rethrow it over C code */) {
3490  thunk->capture();
3491  return loop_control::exit_loop;
3492  }
3493  }
3494  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR reader_visitor_thunk(VISITOR &visitor) noexcept
3495  : visitor_(visitor) {}
3496  };
3497  reader_visitor_thunk thunk(visitor);
3498  const auto rc = ::mdbx_reader_list(*this, thunk.cb, &thunk);
3499  thunk.rethrow_captured();
3500  return rc;
3501 }

3507  return static_cast<unsigned>(dead_count);
3508 }

3535 inline txn_managed env::start_write(bool dont_wait) {

3539  assert(ptr != nullptr);

3541 }

3790 inline pair_result
3791 txn::get_equal_or_great(map_handle map, const slice &key,
3792  const slice &value_at_absence) const {
3793  pair result{key, slice()};
3794  const int err =
3795  ::mdbx_get_equal_or_great(handle_, map.dbi, &result.key, &result.value);
3796  switch (err) {
3797  case MDBX_SUCCESS:
3798  return pair_result{result.key, result.value, true};
3799  case MDBX_RESULT_TRUE:
3800  return pair_result{result.key, result.value, false};
3801  case MDBX_NOTFOUND:
3802  return pair_result{key, value_at_absence, false};
3803  default:
3804  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY error::throw_exception(err);
3805  }
3806 }

3993 inline size_t txn::put_multiple(map_handle map, const slice &key,
3994  const size_t value_length,
3995  const void *values_array, size_t values_count,
3996  put_mode mode, bool allow_partial) {
3997  MDBX_val args[2] = {{const_cast<void *>(values_array), value_length},
3998  {nullptr, values_count}};
3999  const int err = ::mdbx_put(handle_, map.dbi, const_cast<slice *>(&key), args,
4000  MDBX_put_flags_t(mode) | MDBX_MULTIPLE);
4001  switch (err) {
4002  case MDBX_SUCCESS:
4003  MDBX_CXX20_LIKELY break;
4004  case MDBX_KEYEXIST:
4005  if (allow_partial)
4006  break;
4007  mdbx_txn_break(handle_);
4008  default:
4009  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY error::throw_exception(err);
4010  }
4011  return args[1].iov_len /* done item count */;
4012 }

4111  MDBX_val *value, bool throw_notfound) const {

4113  ::mdbx_cursor_get(handle_, key, value, MDBX_cursor_op(operation));

4406 template <class ALLOCATOR>
4407 inline buffer<ALLOCATOR>::buffer(const txn &txn, const ::mdbx::slice &src,
4408  const ALLOCATOR &allocator)
4409  : buffer(src, !txn.is_dirty(src.data()), allocator) {}
4410 
4411 template <class ALLOCATOR>
4412 inline buffer<ALLOCATOR>::buffer(size_t head_room, size_t tail_room,
4413  const ALLOCATOR &allocator)
4414  : silo_(allocator) {
4415  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(head_room > max_length || tail_room > max_length ||
4416  head_room + tail_room > max_length))
4417  throw_max_length_exceeded();
4418  silo_.reserve(head_room + tail_room);
4419  silo_.append(head_room, '\0');
4420  slice_.iov_base = const_cast<char *>(silo_.data());
4421  assert(slice_.iov_len == 0);
4422 }
4423 
4424 template <class ALLOCATOR>
4425 inline buffer<ALLOCATOR>::buffer(size_t capacity, const ALLOCATOR &allocator)
4426  : silo_(allocator) {
4427  silo_.reserve(check_length(capacity));
4428  slice_.iov_base = const_cast<char *>(silo_.data());
4429  assert(slice_.iov_len == 0);
4430 }
4431 
4432 template <class ALLOCATOR>
4433 inline buffer<ALLOCATOR>::buffer(size_t head_room, const ::mdbx::slice &src,
4434  size_t tail_room, const ALLOCATOR &allocator)
4435  : silo_(allocator) {
4436  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(head_room > max_length || tail_room > max_length ||
4437  head_room + tail_room > max_length - slice_.length()))
4438  throw_max_length_exceeded();
4439  silo_.reserve(head_room + src.length() + tail_room);
4440  silo_.append(head_room, '\0');
4441  silo_.append(src.char_ptr(), src.length());
4442  slice_.iov_base = const_cast<char *>(silo_.data());
4443  slice_.iov_len = src.length();
4444 }
4445 
4446 template <class ALLOCATOR>
4447 inline void buffer<ALLOCATOR>::reserve(size_t wanna_headroom,
4448  size_t wanna_tailroom,
4449  size_t shrink_threshold) {
4450  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(
4451  wanna_headroom > max_length || wanna_tailroom > max_length ||
4452  wanna_headroom + wanna_tailroom > max_length - slice_.length()))
4453  throw_max_length_exceeded();
4454 
4455  wanna_headroom = std::min(std::max(headroom(), wanna_headroom),
4456  wanna_headroom + shrink_threshold);
4457  wanna_tailroom = std::min(std::max(tailroom(), wanna_tailroom),
4458  wanna_tailroom + shrink_threshold);
4459  const auto wanna_capacity = wanna_headroom + slice_.length() + wanna_tailroom;
4460  if (is_reference() || slice_.empty()) {
4461  silo_.reserve(wanna_capacity);
4462  silo_.resize(wanna_headroom);
4463  silo_.append(slice_.char_ptr(), slice_.length());
4464  } else {
4465  const auto was_headroom = headroom();
4466  if (was_headroom > wanna_headroom)
4467  silo_.erase(wanna_headroom, was_headroom - wanna_headroom);
4468  silo_.reserve(wanna_capacity);
4469  if (was_headroom < wanna_headroom)
4470  silo_.insert(was_headroom, wanna_headroom - was_headroom, '\0');
4471  }
4472  slice_.iov_base = const_cast<byte *>(silo_begin()) + wanna_headroom;
4473  assert(headroom() >= wanna_headroom &&
4474  headroom() <= wanna_headroom + shrink_threshold);
4475  assert(tailroom() >= wanna_tailroom &&
4476  tailroom() <= wanna_tailroom + shrink_threshold);
4477 }
4478 
4479 template <class ALLOCATOR>
4480 inline buffer<ALLOCATOR> &buffer<ALLOCATOR>::append(const void *src,
4481  size_t bytes) {
4482  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(tailroom() < check_length(bytes)))
4483  reserve(0, bytes);
4484  std::memcpy(static_cast<char *>(slice_.iov_base) + size(), src, bytes);
4485  slice_.iov_len += bytes;
4486  return *this;
4487 }
4488 
4489 template <class ALLOCATOR>
4490 inline buffer<ALLOCATOR> &buffer<ALLOCATOR>::add_header(const void *src,
4491  size_t bytes) {
4492  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(headroom() < check_length(bytes)))
4493  reserve(bytes, 0);
4494  slice_.iov_base =
4495  std::memcpy(static_cast<char *>(slice_.iov_base) - bytes, src, bytes);
4496  slice_.iov_len += bytes;
4497  return *this;
4498 }
4499 
4500 template <class ALLOCATOR>
4501 inline void buffer<ALLOCATOR>::swap(buffer &other)
4502 #if defined(__cpp_noexcept_function_type) && \
4503  __cpp_noexcept_function_type >= 201510L
4504  noexcept(
4505  std::allocator_traits<ALLOCATOR>::propagate_on_container_swap::value
4506 #if defined(__cpp_lib_allocator_traits_is_always_equal) && \
4507  __cpp_lib_allocator_traits_is_always_equal >= 201411L
4508  || std::allocator_traits<ALLOCATOR>::is_always_equal::value
4509 #endif /* __cpp_lib_allocator_traits_is_always_equal */
4510  )
4511 #endif /* __cpp_noexcept_function_type */
4512 {
4513  if /* checking the equality of allocators to avoid UB */
4514 #if defined(__cpp_if_constexpr) && __cpp_if_constexpr >= 201606L
4515  constexpr
4516 #endif
4517  (!std::allocator_traits<ALLOCATOR>::propagate_on_container_swap::value
4518 #if defined(__cpp_lib_allocator_traits_is_always_equal) && \
4519  __cpp_lib_allocator_traits_is_always_equal >= 201411L
4520  && !std::allocator_traits<ALLOCATOR>::is_always_equal::value
4521 #endif /* __cpp_lib_allocator_traits_is_always_equal */
4522  ) {
4523  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(silo_.get_allocator() != other.silo_.get_allocator()))
4524  throw std::bad_alloc();
4525  }
4526  silo_.swap(other.silo_);
4527  slice_.swap(other.slice_);
4528 }

4530 template <class ALLOCATOR>
4531 inline int buffer<ALLOCATOR>::data_preserver::callback(void *context,
4532  MDBX_val *target,
4533  const void *src,
4534  size_t bytes) noexcept {
4535  auto self = static_cast<data_preserver *>(context);
4536  assert(self->is_clean());
4537  assert(&self->data.slice_ == target);
4538  (void)target;
4539  try {
4540  self->data.assign(src, bytes, false);
4541  return MDBX_RESULT_FALSE;
4542  } catch (... /* capture any exception to rethrow it over C code */) {
4543  self->capture();
4544  return MDBX_RESULT_TRUE;
4545  }
4546 }
